item.title: Multiple Docker environments on Windows
item.author: Antoine Martin
item.description: On Windows and docker platforms, your docker enviornment tends to get messy as time goes by. You can start over from a clean sheet with docker system prune --all but sometimes you would like to keep some images around. This post shows how to set up multiple docker environments on Windows with the help of WSL2 (Windows Subsystem For Linux) and Alpine. How it works The idea is to run docker on WSL and use a docker alias on the windows side to invoke the docker command in the WSL distribution.
